Posts.Content: luvmykids143 wrote: Hi.  I was diagnosed Oct. 19th with DCIS.  I have spoke with a surgeon who seems to think all will be ok with a lumpectomy - not removing any lymph nodes - back to work in a week and 35 treatments of radiation plus take tomoxifin.  I had an MRI yesterday but of course do not have the results of that back yet.  The dr. said the MRI would most likely be followed by an ultrasound.  I do have a second opinion set up for a week from now.  I'm in shock.  No one in my family EVER had breast cancer or any kind of cancer.  I've been told "it's the best kind of cancer to have if you're going to have breast cancer"...well, sorry but I don't want breast cancer at all so that doesn't make me feel a whole lot better...  I'm concerned that my dr. is not being aggressive enough.  She said that if anything came back from the pathology reports after the lumpectomy, there is a chance she would have to go back in, take more, take lymph nodes, possible mastectomy with immediate reconctruction followed by radiation and tomoxifin... I'm wondering why have surgery and then possibly have more aggressive surgery down the road after you get the path reports back?  I'm new to all of the terminology etc of cancer and feel very nieve.  Can someone help me with any information?  She did say I was stage 0...
